==Events==
*[[390 BC]] &ndash; [[Roman Republic|Roman]]-[[Gaulish language|Gaulish]] Wars: [[Battle of the Allia]] &ndash; a Roman army is defeated by raiding [[Gauls]], leading to the subsequent sacking of [[Ancient Rome|Rome]].
* [[362]] &ndash; [[Roman–Persian Wars]]: Emperor [[Julian the Apostate|Julian]] arrives at [[Antioch]] with a Roman expeditionary force (60,000 men) and stays there for nine months to launch a campaign against the [[Sassanid Empire|Persian Empire]].
* [[645]] &ndash; Chinese forces under general [[Li Shiji]] besiege the strategic fortress city of [[Anshan|Anshi]] ([[Liaoning]]) during the [[Goguryeo–Tang War]].
*[[1290]] &ndash; King [[Edward I of England]] issues the [[Edict of Expulsion]], banishing all Jews (numbering about 16,000) from England; this was [[Tisha B'Av]] on the [[Hebrew calendar]], a day that commemorates many Jewish calamities.
*[[1334]] &ndash; The bishop of [[Florence]] blesses the first foundation stone for the new ''[[Bell tower|campanile]]'' (bell tower) of the [[Florence Cathedral]], designed by the artist [[Giotto|Giotto di Bondone]].
*[[1342]] &ndash; Mu'izz al-Din Husayn defeats the [[Sarbadars]] in the [[Battle of Zava]].
*[[1389]] &ndash; [[Kingdom of France|France]] and [[Kingdom of England|England]] agree to the [[Truce of Leulinghem]], inaugurating a 13-year peace, the longest period of sustained peace during the [[Hundred Years' War]].
*[[1391]] &ndash; [[Tokhtamysh–Timur war]]: [[Battle of the Kondurcha River]] &ndash; [[Timur]] defeats [[Tokhtamysh]] of the [[Golden Horde]] in present day southeast Russia.
*[[1555]] &ndash; The [[College of Arms]] is reincorporated by [[Royal charter]] signed by Queen [[Mary I of England]] and King [[Philip II of Spain]].
*[[1656]] &ndash; [[Polish–Lithuanian Commonwealth|Polish–Lithuanian]] forces clash with Sweden and its [[Brandenburg]] allies in the start of what becomes known as the [[Battle of Warsaw (1656)|Battle of Warsaw]] which ends in a decisive Swedish victory.
*[[1812]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Orebro|Treaties of Orebro]] ends both the [[Anglo-Russian War (1807–1812)|Anglo-Russian]] and [[Anglo-Swedish War (1810–1812)|Anglo-Swedish Wars]].
* [[1841]] &ndash; Coronation of Emperor [[Pedro II of Brazil]], on 18 July.
*[[1857]] &ndash; [[Louis Faidherbe]], French [[governor]] of [[Senegal]], arrives to relieve French forces at [[Kayes]], effectively ending El Hajj [[El Hadj Umar Tall|Umar Tall]]'s war against the French.
*[[1862]] &ndash; First ascent of [[Dent Blanche]], one of the highest summits in the Alps.
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: [[Second Battle of Fort Wagner]] &ndash; one of the first formal [[African American]] military units, the [[54th Regiment Massachusetts Volunteer Infantry|54th Massachusetts Volunteer Infantry]], supported by several white regiments, attempts an unsuccessful assault on [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]]-held [[Fort Wagner|Battery Wagner]].
*[[1870]] &ndash; The [[First Vatican Council]] decrees the dogma of [[papal infallibility]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; The [[United States Congress|U.S. Congress]] forms the [[Aviation Section, U.S. Signal Corps]], giving official status to aircraft within the [[United States Army|U.S. Army]] for the first time.
*[[1925]] &ndash; [[Adolf Hitler]] publishes his personal manifesto ''[[Mein Kampf]]''.
*[[1936]] &ndash; An army uprising in [[Spanish Morocco]] starts [[Spanish Civil War]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: the Germans test fly the [[Messerschmitt Me 262]] using its [[jet engine]]s for the first time.
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: [[Hideki Tōjō]] resigns as [[Prime Minister of Japan]] because of numerous setbacks in the war effort.
*[[1966]] &ndash; [[Human spaceflight]]: [[Gemini 10]] is launched from [[Cape Canaveral|Cape Kennedy]] on a 70-hour mission that includes docking with an orbiting [[Agena target vehicle]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Intel]] is founded in [[Santa Clara, California]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; After a party on [[Chappaquiddick Island]], [[United States Senate|Senator]] [[Ted Kennedy]] from [[Massachusetts]] drives an [[Oldsmobile]] off a bridge and his passenger, [[Mary Jo Kopechne]], dies.
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Nadia Comăneci]] became the first person in [[Olympic Games]] history to score a perfect 10 in [[gymnastics]] at the [[1976 Summer Olympics]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; 268 ''campesinos'' ("[[peasant]]s" or "country people") are slain in the [[Plan de Sánchez massacre]] in [[Efraín Ríos Montt|Ríos Montt]]'s [[Guatemala]].
*[[1984]] &ndash; [[San Ysidro McDonald's massacre|McDonald's massacre]] in [[San Ysidro, San Diego|San Ysidro, California]]: in a fast-food restaurant, James Oliver Huberty opens fire, killing 21 people and injuring 19 others before being shot dead by police.
*[[1986]] &ndash; A [[tornado]] is broadcast live on [[KARE]] television in [[Minnesota]] when the station's helicopter pilot makes a chance encounter.
*[[1992]] &ndash; The ten victims of the [[La Cantuta massacre]] [[forced disappearance|disappear]] from their university in [[Lima]].
*[[1994]] &ndash; The [[1994 AMIA bombing|bombing]] of the [[Asociación Mutual Israelita Argentina]] (Argentine Jewish Community Center) in [[Buenos Aires]] kills 85 people (mostly Jewish) and injures 300.
*[[1995]] &ndash; On the [[Caribbean]] island of [[Montserrat]], the [[Soufrière Hills]] volcano erupts. Over the course of several years, it devastates the island, destroying the capital and forcing most of the population to flee.
*[[1996]] &ndash; Storms provoke severe flooding on the [[Saguenay River]], beginning one of [[Quebec]]'s costliest [[natural disaster]]s ever: the [[Saguenay Flood]].
*  1996   &ndash; [[Battle of Mullaitivu (1996)|Battle of Mullaitivu]]:  the [[Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam]] capture the [[Sri Lanka Army]]'s base, killing over 1200 soldiers.
*[[2012]] &ndash; At least 7 people are killed and 32 others are injured after a [[2012 Burgas bus bombing|bomb explodes]] on an [[Israelis|Israeli]] tour bus at [[Burgas Airport]], [[Bulgaria]]. 
*[[2013]] &ndash; The [[Government of Detroit]], with up to $20 billion in debt, files for the [[Detroit bankruptcy|largest municipal bankruptcy]] in U.S. history.
